definitions.definition: a change that is a result or consequence of an action or other cause.
examples: the lethal effects of hard drugs
synonyms: payoff; sequela "the effect of these changes"

definitions.definition: the state of being or becoming operative.
examples: force, operation, enforcement, implementation, effectiveness; Morevalidity, lawfulness, legality, legitimacy "the new rules come into effect tomorrow"come into force, come into operation, become operative, begin, become valid, become law, apply, be applied "these measures will take effect in May"work, act, be effective, produce results "the drug started to take effect"Morevalidity, lawfulness, legality, legitimacy the new rules come into effect tomorrowcome into force, come into operation, become operative, begin, become valid, become law, apply, be applied these measures will take effect in Maywork, act, be effective, produce results the drug started to take effect

definitions.definition: the extent to which something succeeds or is operative.
examples: wind power can be used to great effect

definitions.definition: a physical phenomenon, typically named after its discoverer.
an impression produced in the mind of a person.
examples: gentle music can have a soothing effect
synonyms: strength; success; formalefficacy "the effect of the drug"

definitions.definition: the lighting, sound, or scenery used in a play, movie, or broadcast.
examples: the production relied too much on spectacular effects
